Questions.QuestionText: This country, north of the Mediterranean, is home to Milan’s fashion scene.
Much of this low-lying country north of Belgium sits below sea level, protected by canals.
Known for fjords carved by glaciers, this country lies north of Denmark.
This Atlantic-facing country on the western part of the Iberian Peninsula was once a major seafaring power.
This Balkan country on the Adriatic lies between Montenegro and Greece and remained largely isolated during the Cold War.
This Central European country has historic cities like Kraków and Gdańsk.
This country hosts the Geneva conventions and is home to the Large Hadron Collider.
This Balkan nation was formerly in the Soviet sphere of influence and borders the Black Sea, lying directly north of Greece.
This Baltic nation has its capital at Tallinn and is more than 50% forested.
This small country sits between Italy and Croatia, with some Adriatic coastline.
